class_notes:
(Same as LING 411W 1)
Translators are both skilled writers and excellent readers, as the process involves textual analysis, interpretation and creativity. It is a process richer than its final product and requires choices with important political and cultural implications. This course will examine these issues, challenge your syntax, and compel you to consider linguistic nuances in English and Spanish. You'll learn the history and theories of translation, and methods/techniques of translating English and Spanish. Time will be devoted to translation practice, comparing multiple translations of a text, and discussing translations done both by students and professional translators. Advanced Spanish is required.
course_description: This course presents the history and multiple theories of translation, as well as basic methods/techniques and problems of translating between English and Spanish. A portion of class time will be devoted to translation practice and the comparison of multiple translations of a single text.
